conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and properties of processes in the p-V diagram.
AB is an isobaric process (constant pressure) from state A to state B.
BC is an isothermal process (constant temperature) from state B to state C, following a hyperbola.
CA is an isochoric process (constant volume) from state C back to state A.
The ideal gas law is pV = nRT.
Determine temperature at state B using isobaric process and ideal gas law.
Calculate nR using state A: nR = 2/15.
Calculate temperature at state B: T_B = 1200 K.
Since BC is isothermal, T_C = T_B = 1200 K.
Final answer: Temperature at state C is 1200 K.
